section.title: Introduction
section.para: If you are experiencing problems with a failed service, &systemd; gives you commands to help further investigate the issue. Following the instructions below, you can learn how to debug your failed &systemd; services.

section.title: Getting more information on failed services
section.remark: toms 2021-08-20: maybe find a better example than Docker?
section.para: When &systemd; fails to start a service, you usually get this very generic error message (shown with &docker; as an example):
section.screen: &prompt.root;systemctl start docker Job for docker.service failed because the control process exited with error code. See "systemctl status docker.service" and "journalctl -xe" for details.
section.para: To investigate how to solve such failed service, proceed as follows:

step.para: Check the status first of the failed service:
step.screen: &prompt.root;systemctl status --full --lines=50 docker â— docker.service - Docker Application Container Engine Loaded: loaded (/usr/lib/systemd/system/docker.service; enabled; vendor preset: disabled) Active: failed (Result: exit-code) since Fri 2021-08-20 10:24:15 CEST; 2min 24s ago Docs: http://docs.docker.com Process: 2491 ExecStart=/usr/bin/dockerd --add-runtime oci=/usr/sbin/docker-runc $DOCKER_NETWORK_OPTIONS $DOCKER_OPTS > Main PID: 2491 (code=exited, status=1/FAILURE)
step.para: In the above example, the service ran as process ID 2491, but failed. Often you will already see a hint in the error message output. In such a case, follow this hint, fix the issue, and you are done.
However, this is not always possible like in the above example. If the the above output does not reveal anything useful, proceed further.
Check the log of the failed &docker; service:
step.screen: &prompt.root;journalctl --catalog --pager-end --unit=docker [...] Aug 20 10:24:15 localhost.localdomain dockerd[2479]: unable to configure the Docker daemon with file /etc/docker/daemon.json: cannot unmarshal string into Go value of type map[string]interface {}
step.para: With the option --unit you limit the log entries only to the failed &docker; serice.

As hinted by the error message, it is a good idea to look into the file /etc/docker/daemon.json. In this case, the error was caused by a syntax error. If you fix it and restart &docker; you will not get any further errors and can stop with this procedure.
If this procedure does not help, proceed further with .

section.title: Manually debugging failed &systemd; services
section.para: If the procedure in did not work, debug the failed service manually. Generally, use this command:
section.screen: sudo runuser -l USER --group=GROUP -c "cd WD && ENVFILE_CONTENTS ENV COMMAND"
section.para: The placeholders have the following meaning:

listitem.para: The user and group that the &systemd; service is using. For example, the mariadb service uses the user and group mysql. If the &systemd; unit file does not contain a user nor a group, remove the -l and -g options.
The working directory. Only needed if it's set in the &systemd; unit file.

Contains a list of key-value pairs without quotes around. Find the key-value pairs in the file /etc/sysconfig/SERVICE_NAME. &systemd; does not need quotes around values. However, if you really need them, escape the quotes with \".
The command to run. It's usually the ExecStart key in the &systemd; unit file.
